paragraphs.text:
%md
# Agenda

* What is Zeppelin?
* Using Zeppelin
* Visualizations
* Zeppelin under the hood
* Sharing Variables accross interpreters
* Streaming Data Visualizations

msg.data:
Agenda

  • What is Zeppelin?
  • Using Zeppelin
  • Visualizations
  • Zeppelin under the hood
  • Sharing Variables accross interpreters
  • Streaming Data Visualizations

paragraphs.text:
%md

## Goal

* Verständnis zur Funktionsweise von Zeppelin sowie hilfreiche Tipps
* Praktische und reproduzierbare Beispiele für interaktive Visualisierung mit Zeppelin
*

msg.data:
Goal

  • Verständnis zur Funktionsweise von Zeppelin sowie hilfreiche Tipps
  • Praktische und reproduzierbare Beispiele für interaktive Visualisierung mit Zeppelin
    *

paragraphs.text:
%md

## Zeppelin History

### v0.5 - 2015-06
* First Apache Release
* Hive & Flink Interpreters

### v0.6 - 2016-01
* Job Management
* Notebook Authorization
* Configuration GUI + API
* Notebook Export

### v0.7 - 2017-02
* Multiuser Support
* Lot of Bugfixes

### v0.8 - WIP
* Helium

msg.data:
Zeppelin History

v0.5 - 2015-06

  • First Apache Release
  • Hive & Flink Interpreters

v0.6 - 2016-01

  • Job Management
  • Notebook Authorization
  • Configuration GUI + API
  • Notebook Export

v0.7 - 2017-02

  • Multiuser Support
  • Lot of Bugfixes

v0.8 - WIP

  • Helium

paragraphs.text:
%sh
echo -e "%table version	release date	Features
v0.5	2015-06	First Apache Release, Hive & Flink Interpreters
v0.6	2016-01	Job Management, Notebook Authorization, Configuration GUI + API, Notebook Export
v0.7	2017-02	Multiuser Support, Lot of Bugfixes
v0.8	WIP 	Helium"

msg.data:
version	release date	Features
v0.5	2015-06	First Apache Release, Hive & Flink Interpreters
v0.6	2016-01	Job Management, Notebook Authorization, Configuration GUI + API, Notebook Export
v0.7	2017-02	Multiuser Support, Lot of Bugfixes
v0.8	WIP 	Helium

paragraphs.text:
%md # Apache Zeppelin ``` Web-based notebook that enables data-driven, interactive data analytics and collaborative documents with SQL, Scala and more. ```
- Apache Zeppelin Website

msg.data:
Apache Zeppelin

Web-based notebook that enables data-driven, interactive data analytics and collaborative documents with SQL, Scala and more.
- Apache Zeppelin Website

paragraphs.text:
%md # Zeppelin interpreter ``` Zeppelin Interpreter is a plug-in which enables Zeppelin users to use a specific language/data-processing-backend. For example, to use Scala code in Zeppelin, you need %spark interpreter. ```
- Apache Zeppelin Website
* A interpreter process is a JVM process that communicates with Zeppelin daemon using thrift. * interpreter process has a n:1 relationship to an interpreter group * More then 20 interpreters for: * Big Data Frameworks: Spark (Scala, PySpark, SparkSQL, SparkR), Flink, Pig * Visualizations: Angular, Markdown * Databases: HBase, Cassandra, JDBC, PSQL * Authorization: Livy * Other Shell, file

msg.data:
Zeppelin interpreter

Zeppelin Interpreter is a plug-in which enables Zeppelin users to use
a specific language/data-processing-backend. For example, to use Scala
code in Zeppelin, you need %spark interpreter.
- Apache Zeppelin Website
  • A interpreter process is a JVM process that communicates with Zeppelin daemon using thrift.
  • interpreter process has a n:1 relationship to an interpreter group
  • More then 20 interpreters for:
    • Big Data Frameworks: Spark (Scala, PySpark, SparkSQL, SparkR), Flink, Pig
    • Visualizations: Angular, Markdown
    • Databases: HBase, Cassandra, JDBC, PSQL
    • Authorization: Livy
    • Other Shell, file

paragraphs.title: List interpreters Zeppelin-Style
paragraphs.text:
%sh
str=$(curl -X GET -s http://127.0.0.1:8080/api/interpreter/setting | jq -r '.body | [to_entries[] | .value.id + "\t"+ .value.name ] | join("\n") ')
echo -e "%table id\tname\n $str"

paragraphs.text:
%sh
export json=$(curl -s -X GET http://127.0.0.1:8080/api/interpreter/setting/2CW7MMA9A | jq -c '.body.name = "test" | .body.properties."elasticsearch.host" = "35.187.55.168" | .body.properties."elasticsearch.client.type" = "http" | .body.properties."elasticsearch.port" = "9200" |.body | {"name": .name, "group": .group, "properties": .properties, "interpreterGroup": .interpreterGroup, "dependencies": .dependencies}')
curl -X POST -s http://127.0.0.1:8080/api/interpreter/setting --data $json

# Interactive Notebooks

* Using popular Angular-Style model binding
* Extendable and interactive
*

msg.data:
Interactive Notebooks

  • Using popular Angular-Style model binding
  • Extendable and interactive
    *

paragraphs.text:
%pyspark print("""%angular Hello {{name}} !
Note Id: "{}" (see browser address line)
Paragraph Id: "{}" (see paragraph menu)
""".format(getNoteId(), getParagraphId())) z.z.angularBind("name", "Zeppelin")

paragraphs.text:
%md

# Share variables accross multiple interpreters

* inline execution 
* Write to file and read from there => universal but slow
* angularModel
* zeppelin-context => All Spark Associated Interpreters
